010package imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilterScalar;
013import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
014
015
016/**
017 * Scalar version, without gradient array.
018 * 
019 * This code is based on the Anisotropic Diffusion filter proposed by Perona and Malik,
020 * as proposed in Pietro Perona and Jitendra Malik, "Scale-space and edge detection 
021 * using anisotropic diffusion", IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis 
022 * and Machine Intelligence, vol. 12, no. 4, pp. 629-639 (July 1990).
023 * 
024 * The filter operates on all types of grayscale (scalar) and RGB color images.
025 * This class is based on the ImageJ API and intended to be used in ImageJ plugins.
026 * How to use: consult the source code of the related ImageJ plugins for examples.
027 * 
028 * @author W. Burger
029 * @version 2021/01/02
030 */
031public class PeronaMalikFilterScalar extends GenericFilterScalar implements PeronaMalikF {
032        
033        private final int T;            // number of iterations
034        private final float alpha;
035        private final ConductanceFunction g;
036        private final float[] A = new float[4];                 // tmp array for neighbor values
037        
038        // constructor - using default parameters
039        public PeronaMalikFilterScalar () {
040                this(new Parameters());
041        }
042        
043        // constructor - use this version to set all parameters
044        public PeronaMalikFilterScalar (Parameters params) {
045                this.T = params.iterations;
046                this.alpha = params.alpha;
047                this.g = ConductanceFunction.get(params.conductanceFunType, params.kappa);
048        }
049        
050        // ------------------------------------------------------
051        
052        @Override
053        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
054                /*   
055                 *  NH pixels:      directions:
056                 *      a1              1
057                 *   a2 ac a0        2  x  0
058                 *      a3              3
059                 */
060                
061                float ac = plane.getVal(u, v);
062                A[0] = plane.getVal(u + 1, v);
063                A[1] = plane.getVal(u, v - 1);
064                A[2] = plane.getVal(u - 1, v);
065                A[3] = plane.getVal(u, v + 1);
066                        
067                float delta = 0;
068                for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
069                        float d = A[i] - ac;
070                        delta = delta + (g.eval(Math.abs(d))) * d;
071                }
072                
073                return ac + alpha * delta;
074        }
075        
076//      @Override
077//      protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
078//              /*   
079//               *  NH pixels:      directions:
080//               *      p4              3
081//               *   p3 p0 p1        2  x  0
082//               *      p2              1
083//               */
084//              float[] p = new float[5];
085//              p[0] = plane.getVal(u, v);
086//              p[1] = plane.getVal(u + 1, v);
087//              p[2] = plane.getVal(u, v + 1);
088//              p[3] = plane.getVal(u - 1, v);
089//              p[4] = plane.getVal(u, v - 1);
090//                      
091//              float result = p[0];
092//              for (int i = 1; i <= 4; i++) {
093//                      float d = p[i] - p[0];
094//                      result = result + alpha * (g.eval(Math.abs(d))) * (d);
095//              }
096//              
097//              return result;
098//      }
099
100        @Override
101        protected final int passesRequired() {
102                return T;       // this filter needs T passes
103        }
104
105}
